signedOut.title: See you soon!
signedOut.subtitle: Your session has ended, but your savings momentum doesn't have to.
signedOut.tip0: The 50/30/20 rule: 50% for needs, 30% for wants, 20% for savings. A simple recipe for financial peace.
signedOut.tip1: Automate your savings – money that doesn't hit your main account doesn't tempt you to spend it.
signedOut.tip2: Before every purchase, ask yourself: will I be happy I bought this a year from now?
signedOut.tip3: An emergency fund isn't a luxury – it's a foundation. Start with $1,000, then aim for 3-6 months of expenses.
signedOut.tip4: Review your subscriptions quarterly. That $9.99/month is $120/year you often don't notice.
signedOut.tip5: Breakfast at home instead of coffee on the go? That's up to $1,500 a year in savings.
signedOut.tip6: The best investment is one you understand. Don't invest in something you can't explain.
signedOut.tip7: Pay off high-interest debt first – every dollar in interest is a dollar less in your pocket.
signedOut.tip8: Plan bigger purchases ahead. Impulse decisions cost an average of 20% more.
signedOut.tip9: Your future self will thank you for every $100 saved today.
signedOut.footer: Your finances are waiting for you – come back when you're ready!

financialFreedom.title: Financial Freedom Journey
financialFreedom.subtitle: 7 Steps to Financial Independence
financialFreedom.overview: FIRE plan (Financial Independence, Retire Early) - get out of debt, save money, and build wealth that allows you to live off investments. Adapted for Polish tax benefits: IKE, IKZE, PPK.
financialFreedom.confirmReset: Are you sure you want to reset your progress?
financialFreedom.loadError: Failed to load financial freedom data. Please try again later.

step1.title: Baby Step 1: {amount} Emergency Fund
step1.description: Save {amount} as a starter emergency fund to cover unexpected expenses without going into debt.
step1.tip: Start by cutting non-essential expenses and selling items you don't need.

step2.title: Baby Step 2: Pay Off All Debt
step2.description: Pay off all debt (except your mortgage) using the debt snowball method, paying smallest to largest.
step2.tip: List all your debts from smallest to largest and focus on paying the smallest one first.

step3.title: Baby Step 3: {months} Months Expenses
step3.description: Save {months} months of expenses in a fully funded emergency fund.
step3.tip: Calculate your monthly expenses and multiply by {months} to determine your target.

step4.title: Step 4: 15% to Retirement
step4.description: Invest 15% of income in long-term savings: PPK (employer match), IKE (2026 limit: 28,260 PLN, no capital gains tax), IKZE (limit: 11,304 PLN or 16,956 PLN for self-employed, tax-deductible).
step4.tip: Priority order: maximize PPK first (free money from employer!), then IKE, finally IKZE.

step5.title: Step 5: Children's Future Fund
step5.description: In Poland, universities are free, but young adults need: down payment for apartment (30-50k PLN), driver's license, first car, startup savings.
step5.tip: Save in a regular account or ETFs for 10-15 years. Goal: 50-100k PLN per child. For international studies: 150-200k PLN.

step6.title: Step 6: Pay Off Mortgage Early
step6.description: Pay off your mortgage early. Every extra payment shortens the loan term and reduces total interest cost.
step6.noMortgageTip: This step is already complete! You can move on to the next step.
step6.tip: Extra 500 PLN/month on a 400k PLN mortgage shortens repayment by 7 years and saves ~87k PLN in interest. Note: since 2022, Polish banks cannot charge prepayment fees for the first 3 years.

step7.title: Step 7: Reach Your FIRE Number
step7.description: Build wealth that allows for financial independence. FIRE Number = annual expenses × 25 (4% rule). When you reach this amount, you can live off the returns. Give generously to others.
step7.tip: FIRE Number = annual expenses × 25. With 8,000 PLN/month expenses (96,000 PLN/year) = 2,400,000 PLN. With 4% return = 96,000 PLN/year passive income.

header.title: Financial profile setup
header.subtitle: Work through a few steps to build your starting point.

navigation.whyItMatters: Why does it matter? These details let us personalize your goals.

savingProgress.title: We're setting things up
savingProgress.description: Hang tight while we create your income, expenses, loans, and savings.

irregularExpenses.label: Irregular expenses
irregularExpenses.description: Annual costs that appear less frequently

actions.finish: Finish and continue to the app
Finish and continue to the app

validation.goalRequired: Add at least one goal or skip this step

welcome.intro: In just a few minutes we'll map your finances. We'll cover six short steps – from income and expenses to financial goals.
welcome.info: Onboarding is a one-time data entry. Everything saves automatically so you can return and edit anytime.

life.intro: Let's understand your life situation so we can propose a tailored plan.
life.subIntro: A few calm questions will help us prepare a personalized starting point.

maritalStatus.label: Marital status
maritalStatus.tooltip: This helps us adapt the questions to your family situation.

partnerBudget.label: Do you manage a shared budget?
partnerBudget.hint: This gives a full picture of your household finances.

childrenCount.label: Number of children
childrenCount.tooltip: We'll factor in education, clothing, and activities later on.

childrenAgeRange.label: How old are the children?
childrenAgeRange.hint: We tailor savings and education tips accordingly.

housingType.label: Housing type
housingType.tooltip: Rent or mortgage is often the biggest fixed cost – it's worth being precise.
housingType.hint: Rentals and mortgages shape how your expenses look.

hasMortgage.label: Do you have an active mortgage?
hasMortgage.hint: We can then tailor debt and emergency fund suggestions.

birthYear.label: Year of birth
birthYear.tooltip: Used to check eligibility for youth tax relief (under 26).
birthYear.hint: Youth relief exempts income up to ~85,528 PLN/year from income tax.

ppkEnrolled.label: Are you enrolled in PPK?
ppkEnrolled.hint: Employee Capital Plans – your employer contributes at least 1.5% on top of your contribution.

useAuthorsCosts.label: Do you use author's deductible costs (50%)?
useAuthorsCosts.hint: 50% tax deductible costs for creative work – developers, designers, architects, journalists, etc.

householdCost.label: Monthly household cost (local currency)
householdCost.hint: Use the average from the last 3 months.

income.intro: Let's see where your income comes from – it helps estimate saving potential.
income.subIntro: The more precise you are, the better the recommendations.

salaryNet.label: Monthly salary (net)
salaryNet.tooltip: The amount deposited to your account after tax.

irregularIncome.label: Irregular income (annual)
irregularIncome.tooltip: We convert yearly bonuses or tax refunds into a monthly equivalent.
irregularIncome.hint: Enter net amounts – what truly reaches your account.

additionalSources.title: Additional sources
additionalSources.subtitle: Enable the inflows that regularly boost your budget.
additionalSources.childBadge: You have {count, plural, one {# child} other {# children}} – the 800+ cap is {limit}

tooltips.rental: Enter the amount you receive each month after costs.
tooltips.bonuses: Average monthly bonus across the last 12 months.
tooltips.freelance: Estimate the average monthly value of contracts.
tooltips.benefits: Social benefits, pensions – anything that arrives regularly.

summary.description: Based on your data, net monthly income is {amount}. Next we'll look at your spending.

distribution.summaryWithSalary: Your income {amount} is higher than about {share}% of households (chart up to 30k net).
distribution.summaryWithoutSalary: Enter your salary to see your position (chart shows up to 30k net).

expenses.intro: Capture your monthly costs by category. Add custom entries in any section to cover every recurring bill.

home.title: Home and housing
home.description: Fixed housing costs including utilities and small maintenance.
home.hint: Knowing your housing costs helps us plan your safety net.

transport.title: Transport and car
transport.description: Commuting, insurance and keeping vehicles running.
transport.hint: Tracking transport costs shows whether your car or commute is optimal.

food.title: Food and daily shopping
food.hint: Food spending highlights habits and potential savings.

family.title: Family and children
family.hint: Family spending helps us tailor education-focused goals.

lifestyle.title: Health and lifestyle
lifestyle.description: Physical activity and your household's health.
lifestyle.hint: Investments in health and lifestyle influence your financial fitness.

subscriptions.title: Subscriptions and memberships
subscriptions.description: Online services, entertainment and extra insurance.
subscriptions.hint: Subscriptions often slip by – log them to stay in control.

obligations.title: Financial obligations
obligations.hint: Tracking obligations makes it easier to manage cash flow.

pets.title: Pets and hobbies
pets.description: Costs of caring for pets and pursuing hobbies.
pets.hint: Pet and hobby costs show how much you really spend on fun and passions.

insurance.title: Insurance and protection
insurance.hint: Understanding your insurance helps assess your coverage.

other.title: Other / leisure
other.hint: Small expenses add up – total them so nothing slips through.

irregularExpenses.intro: Log larger expenses that happen a few times a year so we can smooth them into your plan.
irregularExpenses.annualHint: Enter annual amounts – we’ll show the monthly equivalent automatically.

intro.title: Let's look at your loans and debts – we'll calculate your debt-to-income ratio (DTI) and help plan a safe repayment.
intro.description: Provide approximate amounts – we care about the overall picture, not perfect precision.

summary.dti: Your DTI is {value}%. That means {value}% of your income goes toward debt payments.

goals.intro: Set your financial goals – even one goal gives us a clear direction for your plan.

emergencyFund.label: Emergency fund – how many months does it cover?

pricing.subtitle: Unlock the full potential of FiredUp and take control of your finances

hero.headline: Imagine a life without debt
hero.subheadline: Where every dollar counts and the future is yours
hero.description: Most people live paycheck to paycheck. Loans, bills, constant stress. But it doesn't have to be this way. Financial freedom isn't a dream for the rich — it's a skill you can learn.
hero.ctaSubtext: 7 days free, no credit card required

stats.title: The Financial Reality
stats.subtitle: You're not alone. Millions of people face the same challenges.

noSavings.label: of people have less than 3 months of savings

problems.title: Does this sound familiar?
problems.subtitle: These problems affect millions. You don't have to fight them alone.

item1.title: You don't know where your money goes
item1.desc: End of month, empty account. Again.

item2.title: Debt is overwhelming you
item2.desc: Payment after payment, with no end in sight.

item3.title: Saving? What saving?
item3.desc: Something always comes up. Nothing is ever left.

item4.title: Stress affects your whole life
item4.desc: Arguments about money, sleepless nights, uncertainty.

item5.title: No plan, no control
item5.desc: You don't know where to start or what to do next.

item6.title: Living paycheck to paycheck
item6.desc: A spiral with no way out in sight.

solution.title: There's another way
solution.intro: The FIRE movement (Financial Independence, Retire Early) has shown millions worldwide that financial freedom is possible — not by earning millions, but by consciously managing what you already have.

principle1.title: Awareness
principle1.desc: Start with knowledge. Where does your money go? What really matters?

principle2.title: Plan
principle2.desc: 7 steps to financial freedom. A proven system, step by step.

principle3.title: Patience
principle3.desc: It's a marathon, not a sprint. Small steps lead to big changes.

solution.quote: Financial success is not about luck — it's about habits.

features.title: FiredUp — Your Tool for Financial Freedom
features.subtitle: Not just another budgeting app.
features.description: A tool for financial transformation. Built on proven methodology with features that actually work.

feature1.title: Path to Financial Freedom
feature1.desc: Dave Ramsey's 7 Baby Steps integrated into the app. Guides you step by step.

feature2.title: Smart Dashboard
feature2.desc: Cashflow, savings rate, DTI. Everything on one screen.

feature3.title: Bank Connection
feature3.desc: Tink integration. Connect your bank accounts seamlessly.

feature4.title: Savings Goals
feature4.desc: Visualize progress and celebrate small victories on your way to goals.

feature5.title: Loans Under Control
feature5.desc: Track payments, plan early payoff. Debt snowball method.

feature6.title: Reports and AI
feature6.desc: Professional analysis and intelligent insights about your finances.

modules.title: Explore FiredUp Modules
modules.subtitle: Each module is designed to help you achieve financial freedom.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.desc: All the important information about your finances in one place.

babySteps.title: Baby Steps
babySteps.desc: Dave Ramsey's proven path to financial freedom.

expenses.title: Expenses
expenses.desc: Track every dollar and see where your money really goes.

savings.title: Savings
savings.desc: Set goals, save regularly, and celebrate achievements.

testimonials.title: Stories from Our Users
testimonials.subtitle: Real people, real results. See how FiredUp changed their financial lives.

person1.name: Sarah, 34
person1.text: After 2 years with FiredUp, I paid off $12,000 in debt. For the first time in my life, I have an emergency fund.

person2.name: Mike, 41
person2.text: I thought saving wasn't for me. FiredUp showed me I was losing $200 monthly on forgotten subscriptions.

person3.name: Anna & Tom, 29
person3.text: Money arguments almost destroyed our relationship. Now we have shared goals and see progress together.

pricing.freeInfo: You can also use the free plan with basic features.

cta.subheadline: Join thousands who have taken control of their money.
cta.subtext: 7 days Premium free • No credit card • Cancel anytime

amount.nonPositive: Amount must be greater than zero

date.future: Date cannot be in the future

validation.endDateAfterStartDate: End date must be after start date
